snippet: Millions will be eligible for no-premium policies, and others will pay more for new and better coverage.
abstract: Editorial cites three independent Wall Street estimates that found five to seven million people will qualify for federal subsidies that will exceed the cost of cheapest health insurance plans for individuals and families on federal exchanges; urges health officials to publicize these plans and do all they can to identify and enroll those who qualify for no-premium policies.
lead_paragraph: Millions will be eligible for no-premium policies, and others will pay more for new and better coverage.

headline.main: High and Low Premiums in Health Care
headline.print_headline: High and Low Premiums in Health Care

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
